**Register-Receiving Ordinal Rites and Offering Rituals**
*Sutra Title:* *Register-Receiving Ordinal Rites and Offering Rituals*
*One scroll. Source edition:* *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

---

**Offerings for the Initial Reception of the Daoist Register**
A pair of silver rings, one hundred sheets of fine paper, one knife, two brushes, one tael of cinnabar, one stick of ink, five taels of green silk thread, one fine mat, ten bundles of firewood, one *shi* and two *□* of rice, one hundred twenty *chi* of silk, one brocade pouch to hold the register.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Fourfold Prohibitions and Qi-Regulating Register**
One large knife, two *shi* and four *□* of life-sustaining rice, one hundred bundles of firewood, seven *chi* and five *cun* of crimson damask, a pair of silver rings, forty *chi* of white plain silk, one hundred sheets of paper, one stick of ink, ten taels of incense, one writing knife, two taels of cinnabar.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Twenty-Eight Constellations and Various Registers**
Six golden dragons, eight silver rings, life-dedicated silk (*mingzeng*) increasing by one *chi* per year, one thousand two hundred cash as stabilizing coins.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Office of Governance**
Five *□* of rice, one bundle of firewood, one hundred sheets of memorial paper, two brushes, one stick of ink, one writing knife, one unlined robe, one black headscarf, one pair of shoes, a feast for twenty-four worthy persons.

**Offerings for the Reception of the *Dao De Jing* Register**
One silver ring, one hundred twenty *chi* of green silk thread, one bolt of handkerchief cloth (fifteen *chi*), one tael of cinnabar, one small knife, fifty *chi* of white damask, twelve inscribed tablets (each one *chi* one *cun* long and five *cun* wide), one brocade pouch to hold the sutra.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Purple Void Register**
Eighty-one *chi* of purple damask, forty *chi* each of the five directional silks, five golden rings, one small knife, five *jin* of incense, five handkerchiefs.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Three Sovereigns of the Cavernous Divine Register**
Forty *chi* of white silk, two taels of gold, two taels of silver, two taels of true cinnabar, five *□* of rice, two bundles of firewood, nine handkerchiefs, nine small knives, forty *chi* of yellow plain silk, a pair of silver rings, six pairs of golden rings, forty *chi* each of crimson and purple damask, five taels of cinnabar, five taels of green thread, eighty-one *chi* of yellow cloth, one hundred sheets of yellow paper, one golden knife, one brush, one pure jar, one covenant tray, nine *chi* of eastern green damask, three *chi* of southern scarlet damask, seven *chi* of western white damask, five *chi* of northern black damask, twelve *chi* of central yellow damask, one mat, five golden dragons, one *jin* of incense, two inscribed tablets (each one *chi* two *cun* long, five *cun* wide, two *fen* thick externally and internally), seven *chi* of purple damask for the tablet cover, four strands of green silk thread, one tael of red wax, one brocade pouch to hold the register.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Numinous Treasure True Writ Register**
Twenty-four thousand gold coins, one tael of cinnabar for the twenty-four qi, nine taels of refined gold, forty *chi* each of the five-colored celestial damasks, twenty-four *chi* of life-dedicated silk for invoking the Five Elders and Supreme Perfected, ten sheets of green paper, twenty-four golden rings, nine golden dragons (three of which each bear nine swords), one central covenant dragon for the document submission, five stabilizing dragons, two *jin* of incense, four strands of green silk thread, one divine tally staff (length equal to the recipient’s height, hollowed in eight sections, with five perforations—left and right—root serving as the head), five two-*cun* talismans of the five directions placed within the staff, a crimson damask staff cover for the base, the remaining five *chi* wrapped in crimson damask, three inscribed tablets (each one *chi* two *cun* long, two *cun* four *fen* wide externally, two *fen* thick internally), fifteen visiting tablets (each one *chi* two *cun* long, one *cun* two *fen* wide), one tael of red wax.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Five Talismans Register**
Three pairs of golden rings, one handkerchief (five *chi* long), three bolts of silk, two taels of silver, five mirrors (nine *cun* in diameter), one bolt each of the five directional silks, two inscribed tablets (same dimensions as the Three Sovereigns’ tablets), seven *chi* of crimson damask for the tablet cover, four strands of green silk thread, one tael of red wax.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Highest Clarity Register**
Nine taels of refined gold, five bright mirrors, ninety *chi* of green gauze, forty *chi* each of crimson, white, yellow, green, and purple damask, life-dedicated silk increasing by one *chi* per year, five *chi* of scarlet gauze headscarf, five incense burners, five incense boxes, five incense tables, five large mats, nine *chi* of green silk cord, fourteen golden rings, three stabilizing dragons, three jade dragons, three jade fish, four jade figures, four golden figures, three golden fish, five bolts of silk, one tael of cinnabar, two inscribed tablets, seven *chi* of azure damask for the tablet cover, one tael of red wax, four strands of green silk thread, seventeen visiting tablets, three submission tablets.

**Offerings for the Reception of the Transcendent’s Contract Register**
Three pairs of golden rings, nine taels of refined gold, five bright mirrors, one *jin* of incense, one bolt each of the five directional silks, life-dedicated silk increasing by one *chi* per year, one brush, one small knife, one handkerchief, one stick of ink, one *shi* and two *□* of rice, ten bundles of firewood, five mats, one hundred sheets of fine paper, five bolts of silk, one golden attendant (five *chi* five *cun* tall).

*Mandate of Qi-Register Lineage*

**Register of Life and Qi-Lineage**

Those born in the first and second months are registered under the Nine Qi Heavenly Lords and the Azure Heaven. Those born in the fourth and fifth months are registered under the Three Qi Heavenly Lords and the Cinnabar Heaven—alternatively called the Vermilion Heaven. Those born in the seventh and eighth months are registered under the Seven Qi Heavenly Lords and the White Heaven. Those born in the tenth and eleventh months are registered under the Five Qi Heavenly Lords and the Mysterious Heaven—alternatively called the Black Heaven. Those born in the third, sixth, ninth, and twelfth months are registered under the One Qi Heavenly Lord and the Yellow Heaven—alternatively called the Brahma Qi Heavenly Lord.

The *Inner Tone of the Eight Luminaries* states: For those born in a given qi-heaven, those born in the first and second months receive their dharma within the Nine Qi Heaven. Those born in the fourth and fifth months receive their dharma within the Three Qi Heaven. Those born in the seventh and eighth months receive their dharma within the Seven Qi Heaven. Those born in the tenth and eleventh months receive their dharma within the Five Qi Heaven. Those born in the third, sixth, ninth, and twelfth months receive their dharma within the One Qi Heaven—alternatively, within the Brahma Qi Heaven.

Those born in the *yin* and *mao* months are registered under the Azure Emperor. Those born in the *si* and *wu* months are registered under the Vermilion Emperor. Those born in the *shen* and *you* months are registered under the White Emperor. Those born in the *hai* and *zi* months are registered under the Black Emperor. Those born in the *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, and *wei* months are registered under the Yellow Emperor.

**Summoning Qi in the Vajra Youth Register**
For those born in the first month: summoned by the Long-Life Qi Lord of the Eastern Upper Yi’s Level Qi.
For those born in the second month: summoned by the Plain Qi Lord of the Central Yi.
For those born in the third month: summoned by the Calendar Qi Lord of the Nine Yi’s Lower Origin.
For those born in the fourth month: summoned by the Vital Qi Lord of the Southern Eight Man’s Upper Origin Plain Calendar.
For those born in the fifth month: summoned by the Dripping Qi Lord of the Central Origin’s Three Yangs Observing Mechanism.
For those born in the sixth month: summoned by the Joyous Life Lord of the Lower Origin’s Calendar Degree Three Yangs.
For those born in the seventh month: summoned by the Upper Immortal Perfected Bright Lord of the Western Upper Rong.
For those born in the eighth month: summoned by the Central Immortal Perfected Spirit Qi Lord of the Central Rong.
For those born in the ninth month: summoned by the Yang Qi Lord of the Lower Rong’s Lower Immortal Perfected.
For those born in the tenth month: summoned by the Harmonious Bright Qi Lord of the Northern Upper Di.
For those born in the eleventh month: summoned by the Refined Immortal Qi Lord of the Northern Central Di.
For those born in the twelfth month: summoned by the Refined Spirit Perfected Text Qi Lord of the Northern Lower Di.

If the birth month is unknown, men are assigned from the first month, and women from the tenth month as the standard.

Those born in the *yin* and *mao* months belong to the Azure Emperor, the life mandate of Mount Tai of the Eastern Marchmount, and are registered under the Eastern Dipper of the Nine Qi Heaven.
Those born in the *si* and *wu* months belong to the Vermilion Emperor, the life mandate of Mount Heng of the Southern Marchmount, and are registered under the Southern Dipper of the Three Qi Heaven.
Those born in the *shen* and *you* months belong to the White Emperor, the life mandate of Mount Hua of the Western Marchmount, and are registered under the Western Dipper of the Seven Qi Heaven.
Those born in the *hai* and *zi* months belong to the Black Emperor, the life mandate of Mount Heng of the Northern Marchmount, and are registered under the Northern Dipper of the Five Qi Heaven.
Those born in the *chen*, *xu*, *chou*, and *wei* months belong to the Yellow Emperor, the life mandate of Mount Songgao of the Central Marchmount, and are registered under the Central Dipper of the One Qi Heaven.

**Heavenly Descent of Perfected Essence**
Those born in the first month were conceived in the fourth month, with Perfected essence descending from the Cinnabar Heaven.
Those born in the second month were conceived in the fifth month, with Perfected essence descending from the Cinnabar Heaven.
Those born in the third month were conceived in the sixth month, with Perfected essence descending from the Yellow Heaven.
Those born in the fourth month were conceived in the seventh month, with Perfected essence descending from the White Heaven.
Those born in the fifth month were conceived in the eighth month, with Perfected essence descending from the White Heaven.
Those born in the sixth month were conceived in the ninth month, with Perfected essence descending from the Yellow Heaven.
Those born in the seventh month were conceived in the tenth month, with Perfected essence descending from the Mysterious Heaven.
Those born in the eighth month were conceived in the eleventh month, with Perfected essence descending from the Mysterious Heaven.
Those born in the ninth month were conceived in the twelfth month, with Perfected essence descending from the Yellow Heaven.
Those born in the tenth month were conceived in the first month, with Perfected essence descending from the Azure Heaven.
Those born in the eleventh month were conceived in the second month, with Perfected essence descending from the Azure Heaven.
Those born in the twelfth month were conceived in the third month, with Perfected essence descending from the Yellow Heaven.

**Stellar Affiliation**
Those born in the *zi* month belong to the First Yang Brightness Star.
Those born in the *chou* and *hai* months belong to the Second Yin Essence Star.
Those born in the *yin* and *xu* months belong to the Third Perfected Person Star.
Those born in the *mao* and *you* months belong to the Fourth Mysterious Darkness Star.
Those born in the *chen* and *shen* months belong to the Fifth Cinnabar Origin Star.
Those born in the *si* and *wei* months belong to the Sixth Northern Culmen Star.
Those born in the *wu* month belong to the Seventh Celestial Pass Star.

Those born in the fourth and fifth months are governed by the Vermilion Heaven’s Qi, which unifies the Perfected.
Those born in the seventh and eighth months are governed by the White Heaven’s Qi, which unifies the Perfected.
Those born in the tenth and eleventh months are governed by the Mysterious Heaven’s Qi, which unifies the Perfected.
Those born in the third, sixth, ninth, and twelfth months are governed by the Yellow Heaven’s Qi, which unifies the Perfected.

The above is to be inscribed in the *Eight Luminaries Purple Void Register* and the *Purple Void Memorial*, all to be used in the same manner.

**Scripture of the Sequence of Names, Styles, Appearances, Abodes, and Locations of the Three Masters and Five Guarantors**
It is said: Without a master, one cannot attain salvation; without a master, one cannot attain immortality.
It is also said: First visualize the Three Masters, then perform the Dao.
Whenever one wishes to read scriptures, expound teachings, perform rituals, burn incense, enter chambers, or ascend altars, one must first pay homage to the master and visualize them.
Next, one should make vows to deliver the nine generations of ancestors and oneself; if this method is not followed, the Perfected Spirits will not descend.
When paying homage to the master, one must know their location; when visualizing them, one must clearly recognize their appearance.
At the time of receiving the Dao, the master shall instruct accordingly.
Thus, from the Orthodox Unity upward to the Cavernous Perfection, upon receiving the Three Masters’ names, styles, appearances, abodes, and locations, they are listed as follows:

The Master of Fire governs the Upper Realm of the Starry Lodge, located within the boundaries of Hanyang County.

**2. Baishi Abbey**
The Master of Metal governs the Upper Realm of Zhang Lodge, located within the boundaries of Hanyang County.

**3. Zhongmao Abbey**
The Master of Water governs the Upper Realm of Yi Lodge, located within the boundaries of Fukou County.

**4. Jushan Abbey**
The Master of Earth governs the Upper Realm of Han Lodge, located within the boundaries of Guangyang County.

In the third year of Jian’an, the Celestial Master, in the *Taizhen Code*, stated: On the seventh day of the first month of the first year, the four Lower Abbeys were bestowed, transmitted to the Heir Master, and from the Heir Master to the Lineage Master, to complete the twenty-eight lodges. Upon receiving an abbey, eighteen worthy individuals were to be feasted.

The *Taizhen Code* states: Those outside are called Separate Abbeys; those within are called Supplementary Abbeys, totaling twenty-four and completing twenty-eight. The Separate Abbeys correspond to the three eights.

**1. Liyuan Abbey**, Master of Metal, paired with Changli Abbey.
**2. Lilǐ Abbey**, Master of Wood, paired with Lishang Abbey.
**3. Pinggong Abbey**, Master of Water, paired with Yongquan Abbey.
**4. Gongmu Abbey**, Master of Earth, paired with Chougeng Abbey. (Note: Gongmu shares its name with the fourth of the Lower Eight Abbeys.)

**5. Tiantai Abbey**, Master of Wood, paired with Benzhu Abbey.
**6. Laixiang Abbey**, Master of Water, paired with Mengqin Abbey.
**7. Zunling Abbey**, Master of Water, paired with Pinggai Abbey.
**8. Daiyuan Abbey**, Master of Metal, paired with Yuntai Abbey.

On the fifth day of the tenth month of the first year of Jian’an, at sunrise, the Celestial Master bestowed the eight paired abbeys, transmitting them to the Heir Master, who then passed them to the Lineage Master. Upon receiving an abbey, fourteen worthy individuals were to be feasted. One version states fourteen, another twelve, and another omits the feasting of worthies. If following the previous convention of descending by fourteen, twelve would be appropriate; the discrepancy is likely an error.

Among the four versions, all include Stone Chambers, but none include Zunling or Stone Hall. The *Taizhen Code* also omits Stone Hall but includes Zunling; thus, Zunling is now confirmed as correct.

These are all paired with the Middle Eight, yet Jushan is uniquely absent, and Yuntai is irregularly paired among them. This creates a deficiency of one, deepening the confusion. Moreover, their locations within commanderies and counties remain uncertain, and their exact placements are unclear.

**1. Emei Abbey**, Master of Metal, in Shu Commandery.
**2. Qingcheng Abbey**, Master of Water, in Shu Commandery.
**3. Taihua Abbey**, Master of Wood, in Jingzhao Chang’an. (Note: One version mistakenly writes "Wood Leaf"; the *Taizhen Code* also places Taihua here.)
**4. Huangjin Abbey**, Master of Wood, in Quyang County of Shu Commandery.
**5. Cimu Abbey**, Master of Metal, in Chengdu Commandery.
**6. Afeng Abbey**, Master of Fire.
**7. Pingdu Abbey**, Master of Water, in Jianwei Commandery.
**8. Jiyang Abbey**, Master of Earth, in Ye County of Wei Commandery.

The above eight abbeys were established by the Lineage Master and disseminated on the fifth day of the tenth month of the third year of Jian’an. Upon receiving an abbey, twelve worthy individuals were to be feasted. These are called the Itinerant Abbeys, and their sequence is now confirmed in alignment with the *Taizhen Code*. Some texts, however, list Jiyang as the seventh and Pingdu as the eighth, which is incorrect.

Left: **Lingjue 1**, Emei’s Right: **Lingjue**.
Left: **Xuanwei 2**, Qingcheng’s Right: **Xuanwei**.
Left: **Gongping 3**, Taihua’s Right: **Gongping**.
Left: **Lianping 4**, Huangjin’s Right: **Lianping**.
Left: **Xingjiao 5**, Cimu’s Right: **Xingjiao**.
Left: **Weiyi 6**, Afeng’s Right: **Weiyi**.
Left: **Chengqi 7**, Pingdu’s Right: **Chengqi**.
Left: **Jianyi 8**, Jiyang’s Right: **Jianyi**.

The above sixteen Official Libationers were established by the Lineage Master. Only two versions preserve the sequence as above; three others are disordered and difficult to clarify.

Since these officials were established by the Lineage Master, they should correspond to the abbeys disseminated by the Lineage Master, such as Emei and others. Now, each abbey is annotated below. If pairing abbeys, the preceding *Du Jian* and subsequent qi should be used; if separating, *Jian Gong* and subsequent qi should be applied. Each should be paired according to its proper sequence.

In total, there are four ranks and forty-four abbeys. According to the abbey rituals, from the earliest to the most revered, the order is: first the Itinerant Abbeys, second the Separate Abbeys, third the Paired Abbeys, and fourth the Three Eights’ Principal Abbeys—these are the four ranks of abbeys.

The *Taizhen Code* lists them as: first the Separate Abbeys, second the Itinerant Abbeys, third the Paired Abbeys, and fourth the Unified Abbeys. Reasoning from the code, this would imply the Itinerant Abbeys outrank the Separate Abbeys, which is incorrect. How do we know this? The Itinerant Abbeys were established by the Lineage Master, while the Separate Abbeys were bestowed by Heaven, embodying the principle of supplementing the lodges for the spring and autumn seasons. A child does not precede the father; how could a grandson’s establishment surpass the grandfather’s? This is decisively incorrect. Following the principles of Rong’s exegesis, the Itinerant Abbeys are subordinate to the Separate Abbeys; this is the true and correct understanding.

The **Gongping** office governs the qi and numbers of Heaven and Earth, ranks alongside the Master, oversees all abbeys, and manages the affairs of spirits.

**Original Destiny Talismans**
*Primary Abbey of the Azure Emperor’s True Talisman, Dongyue Master [Name], age [number], born in the [month] of [year].*

**Original True Talismans of the Five Emperors**
- Original True Talisman of the Azure Emperor: azure script on red ground.
- Original True Talisman of the Vermilion Emperor: vermilion script on yellow ground.
- Original True Talisman of the Yellow Emperor: yellow script on white ground.
- Original True Talisman of the White Emperor: white script on black ground.
- Original True Talisman of the Black Emperor: black script on azure ground.

**Heaven-Soaring, Earth-Anchoring Talismans**
- **Three Sovereigns’ Tablet Talisman**: yellow ground, tablet wrapped in purple silk, seven feet in length.
- **Shangqing Tablet Talisman**: yellow ground, tablet wrapped in azure silk, seven feet in length.
- **Five Talismans’ Tablet Talisman**: white ground, tablet wrapped in crimson silk, seven feet in length.
- **True Script Tablet Talisman**: yellow ground, tablet wrapped in crimson silk, twelve feet in length.
- **True Script Depository Tablet Talisman**: yellow ground.

**Inner Talismans of the Staff**
- Vermilion ground, azure script.
- Yellow ground, vermilion script.
- White ground, yellow script.
- Black ground, white script.
- Azure ground, black script.

The ritual sequence and protocols for receiving registers conclude here.
